title: 2011–12 Mersin İdmanyurdu season
text:
Mersin İdmanyurdu (also "Mersin İdman Yurdu", "Mersin İY", or "MİY") Sports Club; located in <a href="Mersin">Mersin</a>, east <a href="Mediterranean%20Region%2C%20Turkey">Mediterranean</a> coast of <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a> in 2011-2012. <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2011–12</a> season was the 12th season of <a href="Mersin%20%C4%B0dmanyurdu">Mersin İdmanyurdu</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> team in <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a>, the top level division in <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a>. <a href="Mersin%20%C4%B0dmanyurdu">Mersin İdmanyurdu</a> football team has finished <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20TFF%20First%20League">2010–11</a> season at 1st place in <a href="TFF%20First%20League">TFF First League</a>. The team has promoted to <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2011–12 Süper Lig</a>. The aim of team was remaining in the league for the first year after promotion. MİY finished season at 13th place and remained in the league. Team participated in <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Turkish%20Cup">2011–12</a> <a href="Turkish%20Cup">Turkish Cup</a> and was eliminated at Round 3.
<a href="Ali%20Kahramanl%C4%B1">Ali Kahramanlı</a> was club president. <a href="Nurullah%20Sa%C4%9Flam">Nurullah Sağlam</a> who won the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20TFF%20First%20League">2010–11</a> <a href="TFF%20First%20League">TFF First League</a> championship has continued as head coach. 11 of the players were saved in the team and some known players from <a href="Be%C5%9Fikta%C5%9F%20J.K.">Beşiktaş</a>, <a href="Bursaspor">Bursaspor</a> and <a href="Sivasspor">Sivasspor</a> were transferred in pre-season. Attacking midfielder <a href="Andr%C3%A9%20Moritz">André Moritz</a> was the most appeared player with 33 apps. <a href="M%C3%A1rcio%20Nobre">Márcio Nobre</a> who known as Mert Nobre in Turkey was the top goalscorer with ten goals.
Pre-season.
MİY team started to first preparation camp period in <a href="Isparta">Isparta</a>, <a href="Davraz">Davraz</a> on 27 June 2011. Preparation games:
First camp period ended on 12 July 2011. Second camp period started in <a href="Austria">Austria</a>, on 17 July 2011. Planned preparation games could not be played during Austria camp due to several reasons. One preparation game was played:
Second camp period ended on 30 July 2011. A third camp period is being planned because a delay in the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2011–12 Süper Lig</a> is in the concern due to <a href="2011%20Turkish%20football%20corruption%20scandal">manipulation matters</a> which <a href="Turkish%20Football%20Federation">TFF</a> deals with. Preceding to the third camp, MİY attended in a tournament in Ankara, which <a href="Ankarag%C3%BCc%C3%BC">Ankaragücü</a> club organized and the revenue obtained from the audience was donated to people suffering from <a href="2011%20Horn%20of%20Africa%20famine">famine</a> in <a href="Somalia">Somalia</a>. The games played in this tournament were:
After <a href="Turkish%20Radio%20and%20Television%20Corporation">TRT</a> Cup played in Ankara, MİY remained in Ankaragücü sports complex. Three more preparation games were played before the start of the season:
2011–12 Süper Lig participation.
Mersin İdmanyurdu participated in <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2011–12</a> <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a>. The league was played as "Spor-Toto Süper Lig" in that season due to sponsorship reasons. 18 teams attended. A play-off system introduced for the first time in league history. Top four teams play two-leg league system play-offs. The winners and runners-up of the play-off were qualify for <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">2012–13</a> <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> (ECL). The team who finished the league at first place qualifies for ECL even if they could not finish the play-offs at top two places. The third team qualifies for <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">2012–13</a> <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a> (UEL). Second team who qualifies for UEL is determined by another play-off which is played by the teams who finished the normal season at 5th through 8th places. Bottom three teams relegate to <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20TFF%20Second%20League">2012–13 TFF Second League</a>. The start date of the league is 10 September 2011 and end date of normal season is 8 April 2012.
Mersin İdmanyurdu finished <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2011–12</a> <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a> season at 14th place and did not participate in play-offs but remained in the league.

2011–12 Turkish Cup participation.
Mersin İdmanyurdu has participated in <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Turkish%20Cup">2011–12 Turkish Cup</a> from the third round. <a href="Turkish%20Cup">Turkish Cup</a> has been played in its 50th season with 57 teams as "<a href="Ziraat%20Bankas%C4%B1">Ziraat</a> Türkiye Kupası" for sponsorship reasons. It was played in four elimination rounds and finals in one-leg elimination system. MİY took place in third elimination round and eliminated to <a href="Sivasspor">Sivasspor</a>. Sivasspor has been eliminated by <a href="Galatasaray%20S.K.%20%28football%29">Galatasaray</a> in the fourth elimination round and Galatasaray was eliminated by <a href="Bursaspor">Bursaspor</a> in quarterfinals. Bursaspor has lost finals to <a href="Fenerbah%C3%A7e%20S.K.%20%28football%29">Fenerbahçe</a> who won the cup for the 5th time. Fenerbahçe had won its 4th Cup 29 seasons before against MİY in finals of <a href="1982%E2%80%9383%20Mersin%20%C4%B0dmanyurdu%20season%231982%E2%80%9383%20Turkish%20Cup%20participation">1982–83</a> Turkish Cup.

2011–12 squad.
Appearances, goals and cards count for <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2011–12</a> <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a> and <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Turkish%20Cup">2011–12</a> <a href="Turkish%20Cup">Turkish Cup</a> games. Only the players who appeared in game rosters were included. Kit numbers were allowed to select by players. 18 players appeared in each game roster, three to be replaced. Players are listed in order of appearance.
"Sources": TFF club page and maçkolik team page.
U-21 team.
Mersin İdmanyurdu U-21 team had participated in 2011–12 A2 League. League was played in three stages. In the first stage, 37 teams played ranking group games in 4 groups on regional basis. 3 consisted of 9 and 1 consisted of 10 teams. In the second stage winners and runners-up of each ranking group constituted final group while the rest played classification group games. In the third stage, winners of classification groups played quarterfinals with first four placed teams in final group. Mersin idmanyurdu U-21 team took place in Ranking Group 4 and finished 8th in the first stage. In the second stage the team took place in Classification Group 4 and finished 5th with 9 wins, 8 deuces and 15 losses.
